intro: Azorella albida, commonly known as the white cushion plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is native to the high altitudes of southern South America. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit, with small, white to pale green leaves that are tightly clustered. The plant produces small, white flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to harsh mountain conditions. Azorella albida is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of alpine ecosystems.
